column4: y Ctrl+shift+up, that might be what you are looking for (and then go and change the key binding at System»Preferences»Keyboard Shortcuts »» Initiate window Picker)
Ctrl+shift+up does nothing for me.  I can manage to change the keybindings.  I'm just trying to find the right window picker to bind to.
I've recently installed 9.10 w/Gnome.  Previously I was running 8.04 and KDE.  I liked the default window picker for KDE better.
huh .... well its the "Initiate windows Picker" on Keyboard shortcuts menu..... change keybinding to something viable and check it out ....
